channel.title: BBC News | News Front Page | World Edition
channel.description: Visit BBC News for up-to-the-minute news, breaking news, video, audio and feature stories. BBC News provides trusted World and UK news as well as local and regional perspectives. Also entertainment, business, science, technology and health news.
channel.copyright: Copyright: (c) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse

item.title: Many casualties in Baghdad blast
item.description: A bomb blast in the Shia Sadr City district of Baghdad kills at least 29 people and wounds more than 50.

item.title: Pakistan madrassa raid 'kills 20'
item.description: At least 80 militants are killed by Pakistani forces in a raid on a madrassa (religious school), the army says.

item.title: Climate change 'brings huge cost'
item.description: Climate change could end up shrinking the global economy by up to 20% unless action is taken, a key report warns.

item.title: Meat row Imam seeks leave
item.description: Australia's controversial top Muslim cleric asks for indefinite leave after being rushed to hospital.

item.title: Nigeria opens air crash inquiry
item.description: Nigeria's president orders an inquiry after a plane crashes near the capital, carrying at least 104 people.

item.title: Brazil re-elects President Lula
item.description: Brazilian President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva wins a second term in office, with a clear victory at the polls.

item.title: Mexico riot police re-take Oaxaca
item.description: Mexican riot police seize control back of Oaxaca, ending a five-month occupation by protesters.

item.title: Security firms 'abusing Iraqis'
item.description: Private security firms operating in Iraq are committing human rights abuses, a charity claims.

item.title: World discusses internet future
item.description: The future of the net is under discussion at the first-ever global Internet Governance Forum.

item.title: Cricket: Australia reach semis
item.description: Australia beat India by six wickets to book their place in the Champions Trophy semi-finals and knock the hosts out of the tournament.

item.title: DR Congo votes in landmark poll
item.description: The people of DR Congo vote in a presidential run-off, seen as one of Africa's most significant elections for years.

item.title: Climate change 'hitting Africa'
item.description: Climate change is already hitting Africa and will wipe out anti-poverty efforts unless action is taken, a report says.

item.title: US debates 'hidden' food fats ban
item.description: Public hearings to discuss a ban on trans fatty acids from fast food outlets in New York begin on Monday.

item.title: US critics pan Dylan musical
item.description: US critics pan a Broadway musical featuring the songs of Bob Dylan, following its debut last week.

item.title: Fierce storm lashes Philippines
item.description: Powerful Typhoon Cimaron sweeps across the northern Philippines, as at least two people are reported dead.

item.title: US general expects fresh NK test
item.description: The top US general in South Korea says he expects more N Korean nuclear tests, but pledges US support to Seoul.

item.title: Serbia backs draft constitution
item.description: Serbia votes for a new constitution asserting Kosovo is part of the country, paving the way for elections.

item.title: EU says Ukraine not ready to join
item.description: EU leaders tell Ukraine it needs to implement more reforms before membership talks could begin.

item.title: Katsav rejects suspension calls
item.description: Israel's President Katsav rejects suspension calls, saying he is innocent of all charges against him.

item.title: No Qatar trip for senior Israeli
item.description: Israel's foreign minister cancels a visit to Qatar as Hamas representatives would be at the same conference.

item.title: Indian shares break 13,000 mark
item.description: India's main stock index, the Sensex, hits another record high as it breaks the 13,000 points barrier.

item.title: Singh wins Volvo Masters golf
item.description: India's Jeev Milkha Singh caps a brilliant golfing year by winning the Volvo Masters in Valderrama.

item.title: Expert witness changes proposed
item.description: A system for providing expert witnesses to family courts will be suggested by England's chief medical officer.

item.title: ABN to cut jobs as profits drop
item.description: The Netherlands' biggest bank, ABN Amro, will cut jobs after reporting a 5.6% drop in third-quarter profit.

item.title: 'Sperm stopping' male pill hope
item.description: Scientists are developing a male contraceptive drug which stops the development process of sperm.

item.title: Experts crack cancer 'gene codes'
item.description: Scientists crack the entire genetic code of breast and colon cancers, offering new treatment hopes.

item.title: Copying own CDs 'should be legal'
item.description: People should be given a right to copy their own CDs and DVDs for personal use, a think tank says.

item.title: Saw III carves up US box office
item.description: Horror film Saw III proves the top movie at North American cinemas on the weekend before Halloween.

item.title: The Green Room
item.description: Hunting bans on vulnerable species, such as African elephants, may do more harm than good, a conservationist says.
